availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James F. Shouse (Powell County, Kentucky, laborer and private Bath Co Rangers & First Reg Cap Guards USA)

body.p: Powell County, Kentucky, laborer and soldier. Johnson County, Indiana, native. Son of Andrew Shouse and Elizabeth Shouse. Married to Luan Elizabeth Adams Shouse in Powell County, Kentucky, on October 18, 1855. Father of Juley Z. Shouse, Thomas Shouse, Jesse Shouse, and Boone Shouse. Laborer in Montgomery County, Kentucky, in 1850. Resident of Montgomery County in 1855. Laborer in Powell County in 1860. Served in Captain Bussey’s Bath County Rangers as a private from December 11, 1863, to April 1, 1864. Served in the First Regiment Capital Guards, Frankfort Battalion, as a private from February 1, 1864, to September 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Montgomery County, District 1, p. 19A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Powell County, p. 38.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records – Microfilm (1852-1914), KDLA, Film # 994027-994058: Powell County Marriages, 1855, p. 4 of 11 of microfilm (accessed via Ancestry.com).
Vital Statistics Original Death Certificates – Microfilm (1900-2011), Indiana State Board of Health, Indiana Archives and Records Administration, Indianapolis, Indiana, 1916 Roll # 3, File #313, p. 1412 of 2052 of microfilm (accessed via Ancestry.com).
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 761, 888.
